intro: Solanecio angulatus, commonly known as the angular sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow flowers with dark centers, surrounded by narrow, angular leaves. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Solanecio angulatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
